column4: trying to configure my wifi usb adapter... what is my next step after i obtain the chipset?
are you using ndiswrapper?
idk. how can i tell?
from whatever directions you are following
i do not have directions..
which is why i am here
thx
ndiswrapper is for using windows drivers?
my card is supposed to linux capable :  http://www.data-alliance.net/servlet/the-90/high-dsh-power-long-dsh-range-AWUS036H-Alfa/Detail
well, if it worked in linux, then I think it would already be working.  and yes, ndiswrapper is about using the windows drivers in linux
it has worked previously on another ubuntu box i once had.. just not now.
is there no other way than without ndiswrapper?
i would rather not use a wrapper and just use it natively
well of course, native will always be better than ndiswrapper.  Have you installed linux-modules-restricted?  or checked the restricted driver manager maybe?
restricted driver manager? no. what is that?
from a terminal, run restricted-manager
command not found
it should be known i have a linuxICE build of ubuntu so perhaps this is not included?
yeah, that would do it
what's lspci | grep Ethernet        say?
nothing
so this is linux in your car?
I don't know about your problem though, I would try this (ndiswrapper): https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Device/RTL8180L?highlight=%28WifiDocs%2FDevice%29
as soon as i get everything working. yes
